title.narrative: Southern Africa Regional Environmental Program (SAREP) Extension

description.narrative: (USAID Southern Africa Regional): SAREP is a five-year contract scheduled to end in June 2015. The Mission intends to extend the contract for one year, using $3.4 million in FY 2015 funds (22 percent of which is attributable to climate change; 20 percent attributable to biodiversity; and 58 percent attributable to water supply and sanitation earmarks). SAREP will continue to strengthen capacity for integrated river basin management and climate change adaptation across Angola, Botswana and Namibia. The scope of work for the one-year extension is currently under development but will achieve the following primary objectives: -decreased threats to biodiversity conservation within transboundary management areas; -increased capacity within natural resource management agencies; improved coordination among government agencies within the basin for biodiversity conservation; and increased capacity to adapt the effects of climate change for targeted communities.
